channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Round 4 of 'Famous Floridians' poll is here. Pick top 5 celebrities
item.description: Florida has a long history of attracting therich,talentedandfamous, while producing somelegends and iconsitself. But which one is the most famous?

item.title: FSU/Asolo Conservatory staging a diverse season of new, classic plays
item.description: A lot has changed in the world and in theater education since Marcus Denard Johnson graduated with his Master of Fine Arts in acting from the FSU/Asolo Conservatory in 2008, but the mission and motivations remain the same as he takes over as director of the three-year graduate acting program.

item.title: Free outdoor festivals and more fun Sarasota area events this weekend
item.description: Summer is almost over, and there’s plenty to get excited about this weekend in Sarasota — fromfootball seasontoOktoberfest, with local bars hosting Bavarian-style beer bashes, including one of my favorites, Calusa Brewing.

item.title: The Herald-Tribune Boys Athlete of the Week: ODA quarterback Edouard Chaput
item.description: Each week during the school year the Sarasota Herald-Tribune selects boys athletes that stood out the week before based on a combination of coach reports and school nominations sent to sports htincoming@gmail.com and our coverage. Those athletes are put in a poll sponsored by Central Florida Behavioral Health Network, Inc. each Monday on heraldtribune.com and you, our readers, vote on who you think did it best.To get to know our winners better, the Herald-Tribune will have a question-and-answer session with each athlete weekly.

item.title: The Herald-Tribune Girls Athlete of the Week: Cardinal Mooney volleyball player Brooke Gruhl
item.description: Each week during the school year the Sarasota Herald-Tribune selects girls athletes that stood out the week before based on a combination of coach reports and school nominations sent to sports htincoming@gmail.com and our coverage. Those athletes are put in a poll sponsored by Central Florida Behavioral Health Network, Inc. each Monday on heraldtribune.com and you, our readers, vote on who you think did it best.To get to know our winners better, the Herald-Tribune will have a question-and-answer session with each athlete weekly.

item.title: High School Football Week 5 Sarasota, Manatee game previews and predictions
item.description: Preview capsules and predictions for high school football games being played by Sarasota and Manatee County teams on Thursday, Sept. 18 and Friday, Sept. 19, 2025

item.title: 2 Florida real estate markets rank among the most…
item.description: It’s no secret that Florida isn’t the cheapest place to live, with the cost of living and buying a home varying significantly throughout the state.

item.title: Appeals court: Student safety outweighed Alfie Oakes'…
item.description: Alfie Oakes, theprominent Florida agribusiness mogulknown for his fiery right-wing activism and allegiance to President Donald Trump, haslost an appealover what he said were his free speech rights.

item.title: Publix, hospitals, courts, campus: A list of where open…
item.description: It is now legal to openly carry a firearm in Florida, thanks to an appeals court decision and an edict from the state attorney general to law enforcement.

item.title: 'Welcome to Florida,' Los Angeles NWS tells Californians…
item.description: “Welcome to Florida,” the National Weather Service office in Los Angeles joked,warning Californians ahead of severe weather— probably one of the first times anyone has made a side-by-side comparison of the weather in the Golden State to that in the Sunshine State.

item.title: How many people have been fired in Florida for Charlie…
item.description: Joking about Charlie Kirk's death has consequences. Sometimes very rapid ones.

item.title: Connor, School Board must avoid closing Sarasota County schools
item.description: Sarasota County taxpayers are being asked to accept a plan that would have far-reaching effects on the local economy and property values.

item.title: Why are some Sarasota residents opposed to the changes at Selby Gardens?
item.description: At its meeting on Monday, theSarasota City Commission heard an aggrieved party appeal from a Laurel Park residentseeking to halt Phase Two of Marie Selby Botanical Gardens' master plan because it would diminish her quality of life and property value.

item.title: Sarasota County offers $30M for affordable housing projects
item.description: Sarasota County will allow housing developers to bid for $30 million to build multifamily affordable housing as part of itsResilient SRQ hurricane recovery program.

item.title: Charlie Kirk: Sarasota Schools investigates 5 employees over social media posts
item.description: Five Sarasota County School District employees arehaving their social media comments investigatedregarding the killing of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.
